trans-unit.source: Provides a base class for viewers that are intended to display fixed or flow content (represented by a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument"></xref>, respectively).
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase> is a minimal base class, intended to provide only basic functionality that is common across document viewing scenarios.
This base class provides no user interface.
Initializes base class values when called by a derived class.
Cancels any current printing job.
Gets a value that indicates whether or not the viewer can jump to the next page in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
**true** if the viewer can jump to the next page; otherwise, **false**.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToNextPage"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToNextPage"></xref> dependency property key.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToNextPage%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToNextPagePropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Returns a value that indicates whether or the viewer is able to jump to the specified page number.
A page number to check for as a valid jump target.
A Boolean value that indicates whether or the viewer is able to jump to the specified page number.
Gets a value that indicates whether or not the viewer can jump to the previous page in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
**true** if the viewer can jump to the previous page; otherwise, **false**.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPreviousPage"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPreviousPage"></xref> dependency property key.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPreviousPage%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPreviousPagePropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource"></xref> to be paginated and displayed by the viewer.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.IDocumentPaginatorSource"></xref> to be paginated and displayed by the viewer.
The default property is **null**.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> dependency property.
Causes the viewer to jump to the first page of the current document (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property).
Returns the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref> attached property for a specified dependency object.

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.
A dependency object from which to retrieve the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref> attached property, read from the dependency object specified by *element*.
Raised if element is `null`.
Returns the current master <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> for this viewer.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> provides a viewport for a particular page of content (represented by an underlying <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage>).

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.

The current master <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> for this viewer, or **null** if no master <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> can be found.

Creates and returns a new, read-only collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> objects that are associated with the current display document (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property).
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> provides a viewport for a particular page of content (represented by an underlying <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage>).

Returns `true` on the first call to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.GetPageViewsCollection(System.Boolean@)"></xref> or if the collection has not changed since the previous <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.GetPageViewsCollection(System.Boolean@)"></xref> call; otherwise, `false` if the collection has changed since the last <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.GetPageViewsCollection(System.Boolean@)"></xref> call.
A read-only collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> objects that are associated with the current display document.
Causes the viewer to jump to a specified page number.
If *pageNumber* specifies an invalid page to go to (as indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPage%2A> method), this method does nothing.
The number of the page to jump to.
Causes the working <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews"></xref> collection to be re-built.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref> attached property
Causes the viewer to jump to the last page in the current document (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property).
Gets an enumerator for the children in the logical tree of the viewer.
If the viewer has no logical children, an empty enumerator is returned.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to enumerate the logical children of the viewer.
This property has no default value.
Gets the page number for the current master page.

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The page number for the current master page, or **0** if no Document is currently loaded.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.MasterPageNumber"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.MasterPageNumber"></xref> dependency property key.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.MasterPageNumber%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.MasterPageNumberPropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Causes the viewer to jump to the next page in the current document (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property).
Builds the visual tree for the viewer.
This method is invoked whenever <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> is called.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.OnApplyTemplate%2A>.
Invoked whenever the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.RequestBringIntoView"></xref> event reaches an element derived from this class in its route.
Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
The base implementation of this method will cause the viewer to jump to the page indicated by *pageNumber*.
The element from which the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.RequestBringIntoView"></xref> event originated.
A rectangular region, in the coordinate space of element, which should be made visible.
The page number for the page that contains element.
Raised if *element* is **null**.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint"></xref> routed command.
This method is called when the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.CancelPrint%2A> command is invoked.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this viewer.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A>.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> object for this viewer.
Called whenever the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property is modified.

This method causes the working set of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> objects (represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> property) to be invalidated and regenerated.
Invoked when the DPI scale changes.
Sets the DPI of the flow document to the new scale.
The previous DPI scale setting.
The new DPI scale setting.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.FirstPage"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.FirstPage%2A> routed command causes the viewer to jump to the first page in the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.GoToPage"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.GoToPage%2A> routed command cause the viewer to jump to an indicated page number in the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPage%2A> method indicates whether or not a specified page number is a valid page to jump to in the current document.
If *pageNumber* specifies an invalid page to go to (as indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPage%2A> method), this method does nothing.
The number of the page to jump to.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.LastPage"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.LastPage%2A> routed command causes the viewer to jump to the last page in the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A>.
Called whenever the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.MasterPageNumber"></xref> property is modified.

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.NextPage"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.NextPage%2A> routed command causes the viewer to jump to the next page (if available) in the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToNextPage%2A> property indicates whether or not there is a next page to go to in the current document.

Called whenever the working set of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> objects for this viewer (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews"></xref> property) is modified.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.PreviousPage"></xref> routed command.

The <xref:System.Windows.Input.NavigationCommands.PreviousPage%2A> routed command causes the viewer to jump to the next page (if available) in the current <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.CanGoToPreviousPage%2A> property indicates whether or not there is a previous page to go to in the current document.
Handles the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print"></xref> routed command.
This method is called whenever the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ApplicationCommands.Print%2A> command is invoked.
Gets the total number of pages in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref>.
This value is updated as content is paginated.
Because flow content has no notion of fixed pages, the value of this property may change if the viewer is resized, or if the content being displayed is modified.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The number of pages in the current document, or **0** if no document is currently loaded.
This property has no default value.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageCount"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageCount"></xref> dependency property key.

If you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase>, you need this key in order to set the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageCount%2A> dependency property.

Call <xref:System.Windows.DependencyObject.SetValue%28System.Windows.DependencyPropertyKey%2CSystem.Object%29>, passing <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageCountPropertyKey> as the `key` parameter.
Gets a read-only collection of the active <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> objects contained within the viewer.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> provides a viewport for a particular page of content (represented by an underlying <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPage>).

The set of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> objects represented by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> property is used by the viewer in order to display content.

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.
A read-only collection of the active <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> objects contained within the viewer.
This property has no default value.

Occurs when the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> items associated with this viewer (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews"></xref> property) changes.
Causes the viewer to jump to the previous page of the current document (represented by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document"></xref> property).
Invokes a standard **Print** dialog which can be used to print the contents of the viewer and configure printing preferences.
The following figure shows an example of a standard **Print** dialog.
Note that the specific appearance of the **Print** dialog may vary depending on the hosting computer's configuration.
![Screenshot: Print dialog box](~/add/media/flowdocrdr-print.png "Screenshot: Print dialog box")
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref> attached property on a specified dependency object.

The master page corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView> object (in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PageViews%2A> collection) that includes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A> attached property with a value of **true**.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage%2A>.
A dependency object on which to set the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.IsMasterPage"></xref>.
The new value to set the property to.
Raised if *element* is **null**.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
A service object of type serviceType.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An object to add as a child.
This type or member supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
A string to add to the object.
